intro: Kibessia gracilis, commonly known as the slender kibessia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Kibessia gracilis is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
